Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery krater with handle root; interior has red-fired band at top of sherd; exterior, cream slip: ridge at neck/shoulder join; handle area glazed; small part of reserved panel on neck to right; below it, frieze of tongues; red band line in white above shoulder frieze: much of a siren to right, facing floral pattern, uncertain object behind; filling ornament consists of large dots and rosettes; red paint on head, wing and on tail of siren and on alternate petal of large floral pattern; drill holes for analysis on broken edge.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.551)
